metadata.synopsis: Karlach reunites with her old friend Fytz in Baldur's gate.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Have Avatar Karlach in your party.2. Origins debug book -> Karlach -> Act 3b -> An Old Friend -> Teleport to Fytz3. Click on Fytz.OR1. Have Companion Karlach in your party.2. Origins debug book -> Karlach -> Act 3b -> An Old Friend -> Teleport to Fytz3. Move the entire party but Karlach away from Fytz.4. Click on Fytz with Karlach.

50.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
50.text: Karlach Cliffgate. That can't possibly be you, can it?

48.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
48.text: You look a little different, but I'd know my old friend anywhere.
48.context: NodeContext: Karlach is disguised as another person

91.speaker: Karlach
91.text: Fytz. If you aren't a sight for sore eyes.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: He's a liar. Always has been, I now realise.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: Didn't you hear? I killed that motherfucker.

54.speaker: Karlach
54.text: Don't worry. I'm going to deal with him.

75.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
75.text: Karlach Cliffgate. That can't possibly be you, can it?
75.context: NodeContext: An old friend spotting someone she hasn't seen in 10 years.

13.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
13.text: You look a little different, but I'd know my old friend anywhere.
13.context: NodeContext: Karlach is disguised as another person

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: Fytz. If you aren't a sight for sore eyes.

27.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
27.text: Where the hells have you been, girl? Last I heard you'd run off to Neverwinter. And that was, what, ten years ago?

59.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
59.text: Gortash said you didn't even give notice.

20.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
20.text: Good you got out while you could.

34.speaker: Karlach
34.text: Forget all that. How are you?

47.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
47.text: I won't lie to you, girl - the years have been good.

52.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
52.text: I left Gortash's gang not long after you. Started working for an arms merchant - still in the trade, as you can see.

43.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
43.text: Met my fella Gregor that way. We've been together eight years now. And - Karlach - we've a little one on the way.

38.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
38.text: Thank you, thank you. Even after all these years, it seemed to happen so fast. But I couldn't be happier.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: I never took you for the parental type.

17.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
17.text: Me either. I wasn't sure I was ready - that I'd ever be ready. But it just happened one day, and let me tell you, it all just made sense somehow.

9.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
9.text: Ha! Woman, I haven't seen that ugly mug of yours in ten years. But if you can stick around long enough to prove you mean it, you've got the job. You're my oldest friend, after all.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: There is. I'd love to introduce you properly sometime. Maybe over a flagon of something dry?

73.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
73.text: Now that you're back in town, you must come to ours. All of you. We'll have a good supper, catch up. You can meet Gregor. And the little one, in a few months.

12.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
12.text: For now. No one can resist the ol' Karlach charm for long.

97.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
97.text: Finish your business in the city, then we'll arrange a proper catch-up, all right?

6.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
6.text: Meanwhile, if you're still in the business of intimidation, I might have something you can make use of in the shop.

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: Not like that. But I've got some very dear friends.

23.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
23.text: Myself included among them. I'm so glad you're back.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: I'll give you all the gory details when we can talk in private.

35.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
35.text: Gods, I'd love that. We have so much to catch up on.

61.speaker: Karlach
61.text: Sorry, I think you have the wrong person.

72.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
72.text: Do I? But you look just like her. Minus one horn.

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: Almost had you there. Hello, Fytz.

82.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
82.text: I knew it! Karlach, my gods!

68.speaker: Karlach
68.text: Sorry - you've got the wrong person.

98.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
98.text: Funny. Well, your long lost twin was an old friend of mine. Haven't seen her in ten years, but... well, I guess she must still be off in Neverwinter, or wherever she vanished to.

40.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
40.text: Anyway, how can I help you?

21.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
21.text: Hope you found what you were looking for.

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: Neverwinter?! Who told you I was in Neverwinter?!

70.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
70.text: KARLACH! I knew it was you, you arsehole. You had me thinking I was seeing visions.

78.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
78.text: It's been so long. Gortash said you fled north - didn't even give notice. I did wonder why you never wrote.

16.speaker: Karlach
16.text: I would have if I could. But it's a long story.

3.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
3.text: Plenty of those going around. Gortash really broke hard in the wrong direction this last decade.

92.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
92.text: I think you were the only thing that kept him a little honest. After you left, things got dark, fast. I got out while my soul was still intact.

94.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
94.text: D'you see he's the Archduke now? What the fuck, right?

42.speaker: Karlach
42.text: Didn't you hear? I killed that motherfucker.

28.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
28.text: Hahaha! Oh my gods. You didn't. Did you?!
28.context: NodeContext: First joking, then realizing she's serious.

8.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
8.text: Well, we both know he deserved it. Incredible. You vanish for ten years, then come back and murder the biggest prick in the city. Legend.

83.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
83.text: Seeing as how no one's thrown you in jail yet, I suppose you got away with the crime, did you? If you're not a wanted criminal, I'd love to have you over.

81.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
81.text: After I left Gortash's gang, I fell into merchantry, as you can see. Met a fella called Gregor. We've been together eight years now. And - Karlach - we've a little one on the way.

77.speaker: Karlach
77.text: Archduke Fox lording it over the hen house. What could go wrong?

32.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
32.text: That's exactly what I said. He's going to be the death of this place, mark my words. Gregor thinks I'm biased.

31.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
31.text: That's my fella. We've been together eight years now. And - Karlach - we've a little one on the way.

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: Don't worry. I'm going to deal with him.

63.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
63.text: If anyone can handle him, it's you. Just don't get yourself locked up - not now that you're home.

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: I saw red when I found out.

1.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
1.text: Must've been hard for you not to have a go at him then and there. Gregor doesn't see the big deal, but he doesn't know Gortash like we do.

24.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
24.text: Gregor's my fella. We've been together eight years now. And - Karlach - we've a little one on the way.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: I'm sorry, Fytz, but I've got to run. I'm in town on very urgent business.

33.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
33.text: What's got you in such a hurry?

86.speaker: Karlach
86.text: Would you believe me if I said I've got to save the city?

39.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
39.text: I've believed every word out of that mouth of yours since I was ten years old.

71.speaker: Karlach
71.text: A long, shitty story. I'd love to sit down with a pint and tell 'em all to you, Fytz.

56.speaker: Fytz the Firecracker
56.text: Come find me when you're done doing what you're doing. I'll be here - dawn to dusk on the daily.

93.speaker: Karlach
93.text: Never mind for now. Bye, Fytz.
